citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
In September 2023 a fully anesthetized pig undergoing a study-related surgery was given a medication to correct an
increased heart rate. The dose of the corrective medication given was more than what it should have received. The pig's
heart rate then dropped too much and became unstable. Attempts to stabilize the heart rate were unsuccessful and it was
humanely euthanized. The incorrect dose of medication given to this pig caused the procedure to terminate early and not
allow the pig to recover. Ensure that appropriate methods are in place so that medications are given to animals at the
correct dose.
Note: This incident was reported to the overseeing ACUC and to OLAW by the facility and a plan of preventive measures
is in place.
Correction: Ensure preventive measures are followed so that animals receive the correct dose of medication(s).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
This was an inspection of the animals and records under CALS and SMPH oversight and some records pertaining to SVM
and LSVC protocols.
Additional Inspectors:
DAWN BARKSDALE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.33(b)(2)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
In September 2023 a fully anesthetized pig undergoing a study-related surgery was given a medication to correct an 
increased heart rate. The dose of the corrective medication given was more than what it should have received. The pig's 
heart rate then dropped too much and became unstable. Attempts to stabilize the heart rate were unsuccessful and it was 
humanely euthanized. The incorrect dose of medication given to this pig caused the procedure to terminate early and not 
allow the pig to recover. Ensure that appropriate methods are in place so that medications are given to animals at the 
correct dose.  
 
Note: This incident was reported to the overseeing  ACUC and to OLAW by the facility and a plan of preventive  measures 
is in place.  
 
Correction: Ensure preventive  measures are followed so that animals receive the correct dose of medication(s). 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.   
 
This was an inspection of the animals and records under CALS and SMPH oversight and some records pertaining to SVM 
and LSVC protocols. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
DAWN BARKSDALE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
